p: Furthermore, no-one could tell with any certainty if the existing drugs would work against COVID-19, or if they could be repurposed to help save lives. It was not known how long would it take to develop a new vaccine, either. Importantly, no-one could be sure if the acquired immunity would be persistent, or if it would diminish soon. Finally, there was considerable uncertainty whether the virus may be seasonal and simply disappear towards the end of May. These were terrible circumstances to make any important decisions. There were many opportunities to make serious mistakes.
